get.summary: Retrieve a listing of user slices

post.description: Request to create slice as described in the request. Request would be a graph ML describing the requested resources. Resources may be requested to be created now or in future. On success, one or more slivers are allocated, containing resources satisfying the request, and assigned to the given slice. This API returns list and description of the resources reserved for the slice in the form of Graph ML. Orchestrator would also trigger provisioning of these resources asynchronously on the appropriate sites either now or in the future as requested. Experimenter can invoke get slice API to get the latest state of the requested resources.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Slice Name

parameters.name: ssh_key
parameters.description: User SSH Key

parameters.name: lease_end_time
parameters.description: Lease End Time for the Slice

post.description: Request to create slice as described in the request. Request would be a graph ML describing the requested resources. Resources may be requested to be created now or in future. On success, one or more slivers are allocated, containing resources satisfying the request, and assigned to the given slice. This API returns list and description of the resources reserved for the slice in the form of Graph ML. Orchestrator would also trigger provisioning of these resources asynchronously on the appropriate sites either now or in the future as requested. Experimenter can invoke get slice API to get the latest state of the requested resources.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Slice Name

parameters.name: lifetime
parameters.description: Lifetime of the slice requested in hours.

parameters.name: lease_start_time
parameters.description: Lease End Time for the Slice

parameters.name: lease_end_time
parameters.description: Lease End Time for the Slice

put.description: Request to modify an existing slice as described in the request. Request would be a graph ML describing the experiment topolgy expected after a modify. The supported modify actions include adding or removing nodes, components, network services or interfaces of the slice. On success, one or more slivers are allocated, containing resources satisfying the request, and assigned to the given slice. This API returns list and description of the resources reserved for the slice in the form of Graph ML. Orchestrator would also trigger provisioning of these resources asynchronously on the appropriate sites either now or in the future as requested. Experimenter can invoke get slice API to get the latest state of the requested resources.

parameters.name: slice_id
parameters.description: Slice identified by universally unique identifier

post.summary: Accept the last modify an existing slice
post.description: Accept the last modify and prune any failed resources from the Slice. Also return the accepted slice model back to the user.

parameters.name: slice_id
parameters.description: Slice identified by universally unique identifier

post.description: Request to extend slice be renewed with their expiration extended. If possible, the orchestrator should extend the slivers to the requested expiration time, or to a sooner time if policy limits apply.

parameters.name: slice_id
parameters.description: Slice identified by universally unique identifier

parameters.name: lease_end_time
parameters.description: New Lease End Time for the Slice

delete.description: Request to delete slice. On success, resources associated with slice or sliver are stopped if necessary, de-provisioned and un-allocated at the respective sites.

parameters.name: slice_id
parameters.description: Slice identified by universally unique identifier

delete.summary: Delete all slices for a User within a project.
delete.description: Delete all slices for a User within a project. User identity email and project id is available in the bearer token.
